definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: You can wriggle around all you like, but you will have to listen.
sentences.chinese: 你可以打马虎眼，但是有的话的确值得一听。

definition: to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
